aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Carbon-Negative Achievement
Amazon declared a historic milestone in corporate environmental responsibility.
Amazon announced that its global operations have achieved carbon-negative status.
Amazon achieved carbon-negative status three years ahead of schedule.
The achievement stems from Amazon's "Green Horizon" initiative.
"Green Horizon" is a revolutionary initiative.
"Green Horizon" combines cutting-edge renewable energy technologies with advanced carbon capture and storage systems.
Amazon developed next-generation solar technologies.
Amazon developed next-generation wind technologies.
The next-generation solar and wind technologies generate 40% more energy than traditional renewable systems.
Amazon deployed these innovations across 500 facilities worldwide.
The innovations include floating solar farms.
The floating solar farms cover Amazon's logistics centers.
The innovations include vertical wind turbines.
The vertical wind turbines are integrated directly into data center designs.
Dr. Maria Santos is Amazon's Chief Sustainability Officer.
Dr. Maria Santos announced "We've fundamentally reimagined what it means to be an environmentally responsible technology company."
Dr. Maria Santos made the announcement during a presentation.
The presentation was at Amazon's new carbon-negative headquarters.
Amazon's new carbon-negative headquarters is in Seattle.
Amazon's operations now remove more carbon from the atmosphere than they produce.
Amazon's operations create a positive environmental impact.
The positive environmental impact grows stronger every day.

metadata.header_path: /Amazon Achieves Carbon-Negative Operations Through Revolutionary Energy Innovation/
/Amazon Achieves Carbon-Negative Operations Through Revolutionary Energy Innovation/

text:
## News Report

Amazon today declared a historic milestone in corporate environmental responsibility, announcing that its global operations have achieved carbon-negative status three years ahead of schedule. The achievement stems from the company's revolutionary "Green Horizon" initiative, which combines cutting-edge renewable energy technologies with advanced carbon capture and storage systems.

The transformation centers around Amazon's development of next-generation solar and wind technologies that generate 40% more energy than traditional renewable systems. These innovations, deployed across 500 facilities worldwide, include floating solar farms that cover Amazon's logistics centers and vertical wind turbines integrated directly into data center designs.

"We've fundamentally reimagined what it means to be an environmentally responsible technology company," announced Dr. Maria Santos, Amazon's Chief Sustainability Officer, during a presentation at the company's new carbon-negative headquarters in Seattle. "Our operations now remove more carbon from the atmosphere than they produce, creating a positive environmental impact that grows stronger every day."
